result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer A Dye was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.
Must successfully complete Drug Court Program.

timeConds.notes:
6 months banked jail time on each count (2) to be used by probation agent if necessary. 
96 days sentence credit on each count.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer A Dye

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from DOC to Judge Anderson requesting use of banked jail time - APPROVED 8/25/17

CASES: 15CF66, 15CM279 15TR240, 15TR241, 15TR238, 15TR239 Defendant Jennifer A Dye in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Defendant Jennifer A Dye in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 11:47am 

15CF66 Ct 1- Def plea of G. Ct 2- Def plea of G. Ct 4- Def plea of G. CT accepts pleas, finds G, enters JOC on Cts 1 & 4, does not enter JOC on Ct 2 due to DJOC. 

15CM279 Ct 1- Def plea of G. Ct 2- Def plea of G. CT accepts plea, finds G, enters JOC. 

SENTENCING: 

15CM279: w/h sent, prob- 2 year, 6 mos banked jail on each count to be used by probation, AS, sub to testing, must succcesfully complete of Drug Court Program, no fines/costs, 96 days sent cred on both counts. 

15CF66: 
Ct 1-  I/S 6yrs-  3 IC, 3 ES, prob 4 yrs, on sobrietor while on probation, $3214 fine/cost, PP $25/mo beg 6/1/16 and 1st of em thereafter, 96 days sent cred, 184 day sentence-  sub to GT,  to be released on March 4, 2016 for first Drug Court session- must sit 138 days, sub to testing, must succcesfully complete of Drug Court Program, cannot possess firearm, cannot vote, DNA sample.

Ct 4- 4 yrs prob, AS, 96 days sent cred, no fine/cost, DNA sample/no DNA surcharge, must succcesfully complete of Drug Court Program,

12:29pm adj.

CASES: 15CF66, 15CM279, 15TR241, 15TR238, 13TR693, 15TR240, 15TR237, 15TR239 Defendant Jennifer A Dye in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Defendant Jennifer A Dye in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   KJB- Clerk. 1050am CT- 13CT101 no longer needs to track, resolved. Waiver of PH filed in 15CF66. CT accepts waiver, Def bound over. Info filed. Pleas of NG. bonds cont. 1054 am adj. Status conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

CASES: 15CM279, 15CF66, 15TR239, 15TR237, 13TR693, 15TR241, 15TR238, 15TR240, 13CT101 Attorney Daniel P Repka in court.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 12:23PM  Def in custody, have not brought her over.  State- Def has been accepted into DC. bonds cont. 12:27pm adj.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

CASES:  15CF66, 15CM279, 13TR693, 15TR238, 15TR239, 15TR240, 15TR241. Defendant Jennifer A Dye in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Defendant Jennifer A Dye in custody.  Kenneth N. CASES: 13CT101/13TR693 (seh), 15CM279/15CF66/15TR241/15TR237/15TR240/15TR238/15TR239 (fpt)  Defendant Jennifer A Dye in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Defendant Jennifer A Dye in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk.  10: Atty Repka to do follow up re: apptment on 15CM279.

SEH on 13CT101 Ct 1:  $3976.00 fine-  $25/mo PP 1/1/16 and 1st of e/m thereafter, 110 days jail, 30 mos rev- credit for any admin suspension, 30 mos IID, AODA & comply.  11:09am adj.

CASES: 15CF66 & 15CM279. Defendant Jennifer A Dye in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Defendant Jennifer A Dye in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RL/JP-clerk 1:53 pm. Atty Repka addresses Ct- motion for modification of bond. ADA opposes modification. Atty Repka responds. CT- modifies face of bond on 15CF66 to either $5,000 cash bond or $1,000 CASH TO GET OUT OF JAIL and must sign up for Smart Start program.  Bond covers both files 15CF66 and 15CM279. Bond cont. 2:03 pm adj.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.
